plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant with large, bright yellow flower heads that track the sun's movement. Native to North America, sunflowers are widely cultivated for their seeds and oil.
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism, where their flower heads track the sun from east to west during the day.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub known for its large, vibrant trumpet-shaped flowers. It thrives in warm climates and is often used as an ornamental garden plant.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, peak blooming in summer and early autumn
plants.location: Tropical Asia, widely cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers are edible and often used to make herbal teas and beverages.

plants.name: Lobelia cardinalis
plants.description: A striking perennial wildflower with vibrant red tubular flowers that attract hummingbirds. Prefers moist areas such as stream banks and wetlands.
plants.funFact: Cardinal flowers have nectar-rich blooms that are specially adapted to be pollinated by hummingbirds.

plants.name: Agapanthus africanus
plants.description: A hardy evergreen perennial with striking clusters of trumpet-shaped blue or white flowers. Native to South Africa, often used in landscaping.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late summer to early autumn (August to October)
plants.location: South Africa and cultivated in similar climates
plants.funFact: The African lily is drought-resistant and often blooms abundantly after summer rains.
